page.title: 17Public Houses in the Area
page.content: There are 4 public houses in this area none feature in the 1985 CAMRA Good Beer Guide.The Buckles Inn is on the A 64 near Askham Bryan College.It is a 1930s roadhouse on the site of an old coaching inn;relies on passing trade, especially meals;has gone up-market in recent years;sells Samuel Smith's-real ale.Ye Olde Sun Inn at Colton has real ale-Bass and Stones.An attractive old building,it has 4 rooms with low-beam ceilings,pretty gardens and outdoor drinking area,plus a substantial car park.The Three Hares at Bilbrough has been extended taking in the old smithy -more emphasis now on catering.The car park is poorly sited so customers park on Main St. to the annoyance of the locals.The Wild Man on the A64 is a 1930s roadhouse.It caters for casual trade.These two sell John Smith's,who stopped brewing real ale in Oct. 1974.
